Hi,

In the Java Gui Builder project, I have a test which does just that.  The
parameters I vary are the different tags I may put in a target XML file. 
I then validate that the documentation for these elements are all
present.

So, for example, the window element may have two attributes.  In my test,
I make sure that the two attributes are listed.  Then, when I check the
control element, there are many more attributes to check.

When I think about varying test parameters, this is what I think about.

Have a nice day !
Francois Beausoleil


On Wed, 13 Nov 2002 07:54:43 -0700, "Mike Clark" <mike@...>
said:
> mark_x_robinson wrote:
> 
> >I have a standard test with needs to be run for different parameters. 
> >I have created an XML file to define all the parameters and was 
> >hoping to use JUnit to run the tests.
> >
> >I cannot see how I can run the same method using different parameters.
> >e.g tests hcannot take paramters and methods are only called one.
> >
> >I could have one test method that does the test for each parameter 
> >set but JUnit I don't think allows you to continue after an assert. 
> >Basically I want to treat each pass of the test  as a seperate 
> >success/fail condition.
> >
> >Any ideas ?
> >
> >  
> >
> 
> I generally don't find many edible plants along this trail.  I ask 
> myself why a test might pass with one parameter value and fail with 
> another.  If the answer is interesting, I'll codify it in a new test 
> fixture.  Usually there are classes of parameter values that can be 
> adequately tested with a handful of fixtures.
> 
> Nevertheless, you might find these helpful:
> 
>     JXUnit for varying test data and code:
>     http://jxunit.sourceforge.net/
> 
>     JFunc for allowing multiple assertions:
>     http://www.gnufoo.org/junit/index.html#failures
> 
> Please report back on your findings so we can all learn.
> 
> Mike
> 
>
